doc.after: The national government in Bordeaux called for national elections at the end of January, held just ten days later on 8 February. Most electors in France were rural, Catholic and conservative, and this was reflected in the results; of the 645 deputies assembled in Bordeaux on February, about 400 favoured a constitutional monarchy. They were either the Henri, Count of Chambord (grandson of Charles X) or under Prince Philippe, Count of Paris (grandson of Louis Philippe).[19]
